snippet: Unpopular and divided, the once mighty House Republicans are laboring to repair their image and frame a new agenda.
abstract: Unpopular and divided, the once mighty House Republicans are laboring to repair their image and frame a new agenda; with their poll numbers sinking and President Obama attacking them, House Republicans long to establish a reputation as the party of job creation and to blunt the notion that they are recalcitrant and combative; attracting positive attention while avoiding confrontation is proving to be a challenge in an election year, particularly for a group that in 2011 seemed to relish showdown after showdown.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and JONATHAN WEISMAN

lead_paragraph: Unpopular and divided, the once mighty House Republicans are laboring to repair their image and frame a new agenda.

headline.main: To Fix Image, Republicans in House Think Small
headline.print_headline: To Fix Image, House G.O.P. Thinks Small
